alert.note: Alert for Hill (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 15 at 6:14PM CDT until May 17 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Texas, including the following counties, Hill and McLennan. * WHEN...Until 815 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hillsboro, West, Hubbard, Bynum, Carl`s Corner, Abbott, Leroy, Mount Calm, Ross, Malone, Penelope, Mertens, Birome, Tours, Irene, Brandon and Wiggins.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
